row.Text: Beat me to it, eh?

I will add that, sometimes apps do need to be closed but you can typically do that within the OS. You do not need a Task Manager to close apps, you can go to Settings > Applications > Running Services (may be different depending on OS version). From the menu you can press Force Quit.
no need for a task killer to do that Sheldon, just go into the normal settings :D

This is a bad idea. It will solve your problem but it will also make it so that if the Google Voice app ever crashes or you are in an area without data coverage, you will not get your text messages. It is much better to leave this unchecked and then uncheck the "Notifications via text message" box in the Google Voice app on your phone. This ensures that you don't get double-notifications, but still get text messages if the Google Voice app can't connect.
Yeah, it annoyed me that there was no way to remove the amazon mp3 app
This will remove the app's icon from your Home screen, but not actually uninstall the app.
If you hold the icon over the bin for a while , you get a "drop to uninstall" notification , the behavior may have been changed by the manufacturer.
Note that usually you only need to wipe when switching Android versions. This differs per ROM though.

@Matt Casto, while you are correct that simply dragging and dropping a home screen icon onto the garbage can will delete the icon from the homescreen, Rohan also stated that if you drag and pause for a few seconds over the trashcan, "drop to uninstall" appears, and will uninstall the application. Which is something I didn't know until he pointed it out. Thanks Rohan!
While I can't exactly answer the question, I strongly suggest against upgrading your radio, for it's the easiest way to brick your phone completely.
+1 gotta love CyanogenMod. I believe they support 15 devices now with CM6.
Is there a good keyword to search with to find apps in the Market?

possible duplicate of [How to remove pre-installed apps like Peep and Friend Stream from my HTC phone?](http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/50/how-to-remove-pre-installed-apps-like-peep-and-friend-stream-from-my-htc-phone)
There's no need to root the phone, it's possible to flash a non-rooted image of 2.x to a phone.
Didn't realize that. Voting your answer up, mine down.
Since this isn't really an answer to your problem (but it might be!) I'll leave it as a comment. What do you need this for? Would Dropbox do what you need?

Moto DROID v1 with latest GV. Notifications via text message is unchecked, phone is set as Receive Text Messages in GV web settings. This causes double-notification (triple if also getting e-mail notifications of new text messages).
Could you indicate which handset you are using? Some have had that feature crippled
The 'click' sound is required by law in some areas to alert those nearby that a photo is being taken. It is intended as a measure to prevent privacy violation.
would be very interested in this, they are often too slow going.

As some history for why you just can't turn it off, digital cameras (and camera phones in particular) were starting to be used by peeping toms precisely because they didn't make any sound when taking pictures.
Many times it would be safe to just install over your current installations. But I've personally had issues when installing one 2.2 ROM (Sapphire) over another (Bugless Beast)
@JadeMason: In the Google Voice app settings, there's an area where you can select the phone number of the current phone. Is that set correctly?
Probably the most obvious would be Clock or Dock and possibly replacement to narrow it down. Appbrain is excellent for finding apps simply because you can search on their website.
After seeing JadeMason's comment on Paul Roub's answer I'm kind of unsure about this now. I know it works for me, but can't be sure it's the best way to do things.
@Rohan: Yes, the number under 'This phone's number' appears correctly.
Internet doesn't show up, I tried Browser, but defaults is grayed out
Is your wireless network set to broadcast the SSID? I've heard of people having problems when this is hidden (and there is no real benefit to doing so)
Actually after clicking the menu button I had to click View Type, then customizable grid. But otherwise those directions did it! Thanks!!!
Shucks. Looks like I may be rooting my phone in the not too distant future.
I am rooted, so thanks for the path. There's no internal setting to mute or change it? Maybe i will have to replace camera_click.ogg with light sabers or something
I'm running 2.2 unrooted on Droid v1. The "Alarm & Timer" app sounds familiar ... maybe it was removed in 2.2?
Yeah, I thought I had heard something like that, but for telephone voice recorder apps.
@Arda Xi can you post how that works?
I have the same problem with my HTC Hero and have searched for a solution in the past. About a month ago I came to the conclusion that there was no easy solution.
Yea I figured this would be the way to go, tried it, says bad signature. I used the Mms.apk that is part of the .zip rom I used to install the current android running.
Thanks! Didn't know about the uninstall mechanics :)
See other answers' comments. Already have non-market installs enabled since I had swype installed :)
That's what I was thinking. I'll check my wifes Droid 2 when I get home and see if she has the Clock app instead of the Alarm & Timer.
What statistics are you referring to? (And if this is due to battery statistics, why does rebooting seem to fix it temporarily?)
I was refering to the battery cache that schwiz posted about. Im not entirely sure why rebooting would fix it. Are you running a custom rom?
No, it isn't hidden. The security is set to WPA-PSK.
Did not know about Auto-Retrieve. Thought that was what enabled all apps to get the sms. Oy vei.

I found Advanced Task Killer (even with Ads) to be a nicer UI. However you don't need it. Stock android has all the necessary tools. Kinda same reason I use Uninstaller vs from the application menu, just easier.
Sounds about right.
I don't see "Set alarm..." in the list of Voice Actions (http://www.google.com/mobile/voice-actions/). Are you sure it is one?

I have a Milestone and I generally use the touchscreen to write text (the Swype app makes this very fast) so I'd like to be able to edit mistakes without having to slide the screen open. Just wondering if there is a nice way to do this, using the touchscreen?
How did you *get* the 2.2 update? It's not being offered OTA...
No, no custom anything on this. It's not rooted.
IMHO there is no stock way for doing this without using the D-pad or the trackball.
Just checked my wife's Droid 2 running 2.2 - she has the "Alarm & Timer" app.

@Rohan: I think you have the option between the app's notifications or SMS, but it's a trade off. With the former, as you said, you have to be where you have data and the app must be running. But with the latter, you are using SMS counting towards your cell plan's limit. Conceivably, you can use a cell plan with data but no SMS by using GVoice for texts.
Have you tried to unset the USB Debugging?
USB Debugging is not enabled.
How do you switch?
when will it be released?
FYI, for HTC, keyboard "haptic feedback" is found in the sound/display settings.
Awesome thanks! The last time I bothered searching for this was in the spring and I don't think this app was out yet.

Thanks for the response Bryan, but that's not really an answer to my question. I'm well acquainted with what the native Google Voice app is capable off. I'm looking for any apps, hacks or mods that will build on this functionality and give me more control.
I'm pretty new to the community so you can tell me if I'm off base on this but your response should probably be a comment not an answer.
I have no Bluethooth (and don't want it either). And unfortunately, the USB cable is wearing out.

The problem is that I'm pretty certain there are no apps to do what you're asking. The biggest problem with Google Voice is there is no public API for developers to build applications against. There is a crummy non-official API, but it returns full HTML responses, not JSON data or similar for developers to use. I've been wanting a similar thing myself, but currently it just isn't possible/available.
I don't see that option on mine. What version of Android are you using? Maybe that is something I'll get whenever the 2.2 update comes out for the Droid X.
I get the same thing with my Droid X. Even after the home screen comes up and I can use other apps, it takes a few minutes (sometimes up to ten) for the system clock to update.
@81bronco 2.1update1 on Samsung Galaxy S Gt-I9000.
I read somewhere that if you use APNDroid the phone will actually use up more battery as it constantly tries to connect to the fake APN. Don't know how accurate this statement is, though.
@Adam: Ok. This seems to be different between AT&T Captivate and Samsung Galaxy S i9000 then. But nice that you got it working! :)
No, these kinds of things vary from phone to phone (unfortunately). So, it is not connected to the Android version.

It's my understanding that a lot of the apps that run in the background will utilize the GPS if you have it on like Facebook or even your browser, hence the battery drain. Correct me if I'm wrong but if you only need GPS for your Maps app then it's best for battery performance to turn it on or off as you use Maps so those other apps don't utilize it and drain your battery.

Hi Matt, from what I have read (I cant find the links right now) it shouldn't affect the battery much if at all, the only exception I can find to this is if you are using the Navigation software and return to the home screen. You can see in the notification area that it is still navigating. hth.
@Dr.Dredel is there some way to add/remove these types of things (available apps/widgets, number of home screens)?
That is not an issue with the cable, its an issue with the power source. Some power sources(usb ports or wall worts) will not supply sufficient power for some devices.
Bryan may be right. I've been searching for this functionality for sometime without success. I've just about given up. I hope someone here proves me wrong.
I also see this behavior. It sometimes happens on screen unlock as well.

I have this on the same screen (and have used steady since i got the phone) with my maps/location apps and it is terrific for being able to instant on the GPS and launch an app while saving on GPS battery drain.
Don't be feared by @Bry 's suggestion to underclock. The best part of underclocking (i.e. with SetCPU) is to create profiles for when you want 250mhz, and when you want 800mhz.
i want to do this from the phone, not from a remote machine with the SDK

Every time that I've seen the browser use my location it's only used the "coarse" non-GPS location (ie cell-tower or WiFi type location finding). This is certainly the case for when you allow the Google homepage to know your location for local searches. Never seen Facebook use my location at all?
@Bryan Dropbox wouldn't help if I have no internet connection
+1 Didn't know you could do that, thought the bottom row of icons were hard coded!

No, it is an issue with the cable. I know the difference between powered and unpowered usb ports and the ones in question were all powered and worked fine to charge my phone through the stock cable that came with my phone. I'm pretty certain it was the slim retractable cable that failed because I tried it on 3 different computers. Data' yes; power, no. Also your comment does not take into account the ac charger I mentioned.

I'm not sure what you mean by swyping from the swype symbol to the SYM key. I know where the swype symbol is, but I'm not sure where the SYM key is. I can't figure out how to do this, but it would really help!

That's not answering the question you are just saying that if it does then it does. Any piece of string that has the capability of charging your phone does exactly that. I'm not aware of any string that has the capability but if it had the capability then it would have that capability. Profound, yes, I know. Not all cables are capable of charging a phone.
Strictly speaking, neither of those examples are part of the Operating System.

careful about using something like "the above answers" in your own answer -- if you get upvoted to the top, you'll no longer make sense. Then you'll get downvoted, and make sense again. And then get upvoted, and....
Similar question is available at :http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/144/how-to-buy-apps-from-unsupported-countries-using-un-rooted-phone
That is correct - updated question text.
It's even bad practice to run Linux without an AV. Same thing goes for Android. Google doesn't check the apps.
Looks like a less expensive alternative to Locale?
Thanks for sharing. It would be great if its directly available from app store.
I believe it is although I have never looked much into Locale because I thought it was for profiles that are only based on location.
That's where I downloaded it from; sorry, I have a helluva time linking to pages in the AndroidMarket..... hrm... that remind me
I have drop box and it works great for file transfer but I'm specifically looking to manage playlists on my computer.
Though this is on an Incredible. I assume the menus are similar, especially since they're both HTC phones, but it may be a little different on your Tattoo.
@Matt - the Swype button is at the bottom left of the keyboard and the Sym button is the one next to it (on the right). Thanks for this tip, Joe.

Yeah, I have actually tried it with another charger and it still didn't work. Faulty hardware may be the cause... I have seen similar posts about people having intermittent problems connecting their Milestones to USB ports, so I'm curious that this may be either a generic bug or a generic hardware fault, rather than just my phone.
A big one is that you can remove critical system components and require a wipe (reinstall). They don't want this. Too much dissatisfied customers and tech support calls :)
I am citizen of india. :(
Appears to be just a task auto-killer; can you confirm or deny this?
